author: Shruti Srivastava, Sudhi Ranjan Sen
description: India is discussing a US trade deal structured in three tranches and expects to reach an interim agreement before July, when President Donald Trump’s reciprocal tariffs are set to kick in, according to officials in New Delhi familiar with the matter.
title: India Expects Multi-Phase Trade Deal With US as Talks Proceed

author: Miranda Davis
description: The US Department of Justice said it will investigate whether Chicago is discriminating against municipal job candidates by race after Mayor Brandon Johnson highlighted the number of Black officials in his administration while addressing a church on the city’s south side.
title: Chicago Mayor’s Hiring Practices Probed by Justice Department

author: David Voreacos
description: The Trump administration was ordered by an appeals court to facilitate the return of a Venezuelan man who was deported to a maximum-security prison in El Salvador — at least the second time the administration has been told to bring back a migrant it wrongly removed.
title: US Court Orders Return of Another Deportee From El Salvador

author: Rachel Cohrs Zhang
description: US Food and Drug Administration Commissioner Marty Makary named agency veterans to lead tobacco regulation and inspections, two high-profile areas, according to documents seen by Bloomberg.
title: FDA Names Acting Leaders for Inspections, Tobacco Regulation

author: Ramsey Al-Rikabi, Courtney McBride
description: Eleven days ago, European leaders took heart when President Donald Trump called for a 30-day ceasefire in Ukraine and threatened new sanctions on Russia. A phone call with Vladimir Putin on Monday revealed those hopes were misplaced.
title: Trump Hands Putin a Win With Retreat From Ukraine Peace Talks

author: Greg Ryan
description: Harvard University President Alan Garber is asking alumni who want to support the school in its standoff with the Trump administration for three things: their attention, their voices and their money.
title: Harvard President Seeks Alumni Help to Boost Case Against Trump

author: Nathan R Dean
description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Every Monday, Bloomberg Intelligence senior analyst Nathan Dean gives his insights into what’s been happening and what’s coming up in the nooks and crannies of government and markets.  Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Assessing the Outlook for Trump’s ‘Big, Beautiful Bill’

author: Gerson Freitas Jr, Gabriella Borter
description: Democratic Senator Elizabeth Warren queried chicken producer Pilgrim’s Pride Corp. and its parent company JBS USA over the meat processor’s donation to Donald Trump’s Inaugural Committee.
title: Warren Questions Pilgrim’s Pride, JBS Over $5 Million Trump Donation

author: Akayla Gardner, Hadriana Lowenkron
description: President Donald Trump signed a bill to force social media companies to remove non-consensual sharing of explicit sexual imagery online, calling it a “horribly wrong” situation.
title: Trump Signs Bill Cracking Down on Deepfake Revenge Porn

author: Akayla Gardner, Ken Tran
description: President Donald Trump plans to go to the Capitol on Tuesday to urge fractious House Republicans to overcome divisions and unite behind his signature tax-cut legislation.
title: Trump Plans to Rally House Republicans Divided on Tax Cut Bill

author: Frank Connelly
description: The leaders of France, Britain and Canada called on Israel to stop its military operations in Gaza and allow humanitarian aid to enter the territory.
title: France, UK, Canada Call on Israel to Allow More Aid to Gaza

author: Steven T. Dennis
description: The Senate is poised to advance industry-backed stablecoin legislation in a key vote expected Monday evening, with a group of crypto-friendly Democrats led by Kirsten Gillibrand and Angela Alsobrooks seeking to end their party’s blockade of one of President Donald Trump’s top priorities.
title: Stablecoin Fight Heads to Showdown as Senate Democrats Splinter

author: Gerson Freitas Jr
description: Kentucky Senator Rand Paul has asked the top US securities regulator to probe two major firms that have advised their clients to vote against a proposed New York listing by JBS SA, the world’s largest meat producer.
title: Senator Asks SEC to Probe Firms Advising Against JBS US Listing

author: Ainsley Thomson
description: Wealthy Americans eying New Zealand as a haven are hoping the government will soon relax a ban on house sales to foreigners, according to advisers.
title: Rich Americans Ready to Swoop In If New Zealand Relaxes Home-Buying Ban

author: Greg Stohr
description: The Supreme Court let the Trump administration move to end legal protections for 350,000 Venezuelans, putting them at risk of losing the right to temporarily live and work in the US and potentially being deported.
title: Supreme Court Lets Trump End Some Venezuelan Migrant Protections

author: Alex Wickham, Alberto Nardelli, Jorge Valero, Lucy White
description: Prime Minister Keir Starmer heralded a “landmark deal” between the UK and the European Union on Monday that he billed as a reset moment for relations under his government. Still, with many details unresolved, Brexit never quite seems to be over.
title: Britain’s Big EU Reset Turns Out to Be Just the Start of Talks

author: Olivia Tam, Debby Wu
description: The Chinese government accused the Trump administration of undermining recent trade talks in Geneva with its warning that using Huawei Technologies Co.’s artificial-intelligence chips “anywhere in the world” would violate US export controls.
title: China Accuses US of Undermining Trade Talks With Warnings Against Huawei Chips

author: Golnar Motevalli
description: Britain plans to strengthen its ability to crack down on state-backed terrorist threats following an increase in security incidents involving Iranian nationals in the UK, Home Secretary Yvette Cooper said on Monday.
title: UK Plans New Powers to Tackle Rise in Iran-Backed Threats

author: Christian Wienberg
description: Denmark is offering 27.6 billion Danish kroner ($4.2 billion) in state aid to ensure more investments in offshore wind as the Nordic country attempts to reignite interest after a recent failure of a government tender.
title: Denmark Offers Aid for Wind Investments After Failed Auction

author: Ari Natter, Will Wade
description: Shares of solar companies slumped after conservative Republican lawmakers said they had secured a commitment from leadership to end key clean-energy tax credits earlier than planned, part of a sweeping deal aimed at allowing President Donald Trump’s giant tax and spending package to advance.
title: Solar Shares Fall as GOP Targets Earlier End to Tax Credits

author: Hannah Miller
description: Wendy McMahon, who served as chief executive officer of CBS News and its station group, said she is stepping down, citing a disagreement with management.
title: CBS News Chief McMahon Quits Over Disagreement With Management

author: Piotr Skolimowski, Wojciech Moskwa
description: Poland’s presidential election will determine whether the country can restore the rule of law and remain a reliable partner in the European Union after nearly a decade of divisive right-wing populism.
title: Why Poland’s Election Is a Barometer for Europe’s Populist Wave

author: Henry Meyer
description: US President Donald Trump began a phone call with Russian counterpart Vladimir Putin on Monday, aiming to secure a ceasefire in the war in Ukraine that Moscow has shown no sign of accepting.
title: Trump Call With Putin Underway as US Seeks Ceasefire in Ukraine

author: Akayla Gardner
description: US President Donald Trump invited Pope Leo XIV, the first American pontiff, to visit him in Washington, the White House said Monday.
title: Trump Invites Pope Leo to Visit White House

author: Piotr Skolimowski, Natalia Ojewska
description: Polish Prime Minister Donald Tusk and his allies have less than two weeks to convince voters to stick with their ruling coalition after a surge in support for nationalists in a presidential election.
title: Tusk Faces Crunch Two Weeks to Fend Off Poland’s Nationalists

author: Andra Timu, Irina Vilcu
description: Romania’s finance chief said a new government will need to move quickly to fix state finances even after the election of Bucharest Mayor Nicusor Dan as president helped soothe market turmoil that’s engulfed the Black Sea nation.
title: Romania Will Need to Move Quickly on Reforms, Finance Chief Says

author: Todd Gillespie
description: US Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick sold his stakes in the Wall Street business group he ran for more than three decades, passing ownership to his children and private outside investors and cashing out at least hundreds of millions of dollars.
title: Lutnick Divests Cantor Fitzgerald to Children, Investor 26North

author: Hadriana Lowenkron, Akayla Gardner
description: White House National Economic Council Director Kevin Hassett criticized Moody’s Ratings over its decision to lower the US credit rating, calling the move backward-looking and saying the Trump administration is committed to lowering federal spending.
title: Trump Aide Hassett Dismisses Moody’s Downgrade, Calls US Debt ‘Safest Bet’

author: Rajesh Kumar Singh, Rakesh Sharma
description: India has invoked emergency measures that require gas-fired power stations to produce more in order to ensure uninterrupted electricity supply during the summer season, as soaring temperatures boost demand.
title: India Readies Gas Power Fleet to Prevent Summer Blackouts

author: Matthew Malinowski
description: Chile ultra conservative candidate Jose Antonio Kast tied center-right contender Evelyn Matthei atop a new presidential poll, marking the latest twist in the race to lead one of Latin America’s richest economies.
title: Chile Poll Shows Evelyn Matthei and Jose Antonio Kast Tied in Race for Presidency

author: Mohammed Alamin
description: Sudan’s army chief named the country’s first prime minister since the eruption of a brutal two-year civil war.
title: Sudan Army Chief Names First Prime Minister Since War Erupted

author: Yian Lee, Cindy Wang, Miaojung Lin
description: As President Lai Ching-te approaches his first year in office, he’s sending a stark warning to the people of Taiwan: If you say anything that threatens the archipelago’s security, there will be consequences.
title: Taiwan’s Lai Toughens China Stance, Stoking Debate on Democracy

author: Aaron Eglitis, Donato Paolo Mancini, Arne Delfs
description: The Latvian government is in talks with German weapons manufacturer Rheinmetall AG on producing defense equipment domestically as part of an effort by Baltic nations to bolster their military capabilities in the face of Russian aggression.
title: Rheinmetall in Talks With Latvia on Manufacturing Arms Locally

author: Jorge Valero
description: The European Union’s 27 member states gave initial approval to a €150 billion ($169 billion) defense fund that will distribute money to countries looking to invest in security capabilities such as ammunition, drones and the protection of critical infrastructure, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: EU’s €150 Billion Defense Fund Receives Preliminary Approval

author: Michael Nienaber
description: Germany is working with allies on a new package of sanctions aimed at pressuring Russia to agree to a ceasefire in its war with Ukraine.
title: Germany Says Working on New Russia Sanctions in Ceasefire Push

author: Alisa Odenheimer, Ethan Bronner, Galit Altstein
description: Israel will take over the entire Gaza Strip, Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said on Monday, as the military announced it would carry out an “unprecedented attack” on Hamas.
title: Netanyahu Says Israel to Take Over All Gaza, Restart Aid Flows

author: Alan Crawford
description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: Three Votes and No Easy Way Forward for Europe

author: Arsalan Shahla
description: Iran said its ability to enrich uranium was “absolutely non-negotiable” after US President Donald Trump’s special envoy repeated a demand that the Islamic Republic cease its production of the fissile material.
title: Iran Says Its Uranium Enrichment Is ‘Absolutely Non-Negotiable’

author: Cliff Harvey Venzon
description: Philippine President Ferdinand Marcos Jr. said he’s willing to mend ties with the family of Vice President Sara Duterte, after candidates supported by his estranged deputy won more seats than expected during last week’s Senate election.
title: Marcos Says He Is Open to Reconcile With the Duterte Family

author: Helen Nyambura
description: Tanzania’s main opposition leader is facing treason charges months before presidential elections, a case that has heightened concerns about the state of democracy in the East African nation.
title: Tanzania Opposition Says Democracy at Risk as Leader Faces Trial

author: Alexander Weber
description: Euro-area inflation will fall below the European Central Bank’s target next year because of fallout from US trade policies, according to the European Commission.
title: Euro-Area Inflation to Fall Below 2% on US Tariffs, EU Predicts

author: Sarah Hilton
description: Japan’s agriculture minister said he’d been inconsiderate after comments about his plentiful supply of free rice struck a nerve with the public, who face soaring prices in stores.
title: Japan Minister’s Brag About Free Rice Misfires Amid Surging Prices

author: Nicholas Lua, Serene Cheong, Chandra Asmara
description: Indonesian authorities have contacted a number of Singapore-based trading companies to request their cooperation in a $12 billion corruption probe involving state-owned oil giant PT Pertamina.
title: Indonesia Taps Singapore Traders in $12 Billion Pertamina Probe

author: Tara Patel, William Horobin
description: French President Emmanuel Macron will tally €37 billion ($41.4 billion) in foreign investment at an annual gathering with business leaders, seeking to send an upbeat message as the slow-growing economy faces headwinds from US trade tariffs.
title: France Touts Record Foreign Investment at Macron’s Annual Summit

author: Patpicha Tanakasempipat
description: Thailand will offer bigger tax incentives to small and medium businesses at risk of being squeezed by US tariff threats, as the Southeast Asian nation unveiled a raft of measures to minimize the blow to its economy from the trade war.
title: Thailand Unveils Measures to Shield Firms From Trade War Fallout

author: Patpicha Tanakasempipat, Chandra Asmara
description: Thailand and Indonesia pledged to boost trade and investment and cooperate on cyber scam and drug trafficking crackdowns, as Southeast Asia’s two biggest economies elevated ties to a strategic partnership.
title: Thailand, Indonesia Pledge to Boost Trade as Strategic Partners

author: Alberto Nardelli, Alex Wickham, Jorge Valero
description: Negotiators for the European Union and the UK have reached a deal to strengthen their post-Brexit relationship ahead of a summit on Monday, according to people familiar with the discussions and documents seen by Bloomberg.
title: EU and UK Negotiators Agree Terms of Starmer’s Post-Brexit Reset

author: Yoshiaki Nohara
description: Japan won’t compromise its national interests in trade talks with the US by fixating on time limits, Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba said, signaling Tokyo isn’t rushing into an agreement.
title: Japan’s Ishiba Says Won’t Fixate on US Trade Talk Time Limits

author: Yoshiaki Nohara
description: Japanese Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba rebuffed calls for tax cuts saying that the nation’s financial conditions are worse than Greece’s.
title: Ishiba Rebuffs Tax Cut Demands With Greek Debt Comparison

author: Steven T. Dennis, Emily Birnbaum, Jarrell Dillard
description: A key House committee advanced President Donald Trump’s giant tax and spending package after Republican hardliners dropped a blockade against the legislation.
title: Trump Tax Bill Advances After GOP Hardliners Drop Blockade

author: Alastair Gale
description: Support for Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba’s government weakened, according to public opinion surveys published by major Japanese news organizations over the weekend, although it remains unlikely he’ll be ousted before a national election in July.
title: Japan PM Ishiba’s Support Falls, No Ouster Seen Before July
